list_available_metrics.description: List all available metrics organized by category (social_engagement, performance, financial, attendance). Use this first to discover what metrics are available for forecasting.
list_available_metrics.returns: Dictionary with categories and their available metrics

get_metric_info.description: Get detailed statistics about a specific metric including mean, median, standard deviation, min, max, and sample size. Use this to understand a metric before forecasting it.
get_metric_info.returns: Dictionary with metric statistics and metadata

auto_forecast.description: Automatically forecast a metric by intelligently selecting the best predictive features using machine learning. This is the easiest way to generate predictions - the tool handles feature selection automatically.

parameters.current_context: dict (optional) - Current values for prediction features

auto_forecast.returns: StatisticalForecast object with predicted_value, confidence_score, trend_direction, percent_change, prediction intervals, and model accuracy

forecast_metric.description: Forecast a specific metric using manually provided feature columns. Use this when you want precise control over which features to use for prediction.

parameters.feature_columns: list - List of feature column names to use
parameters.current_values: dict (optional) - Current feature values for prediction

forecast_metric.returns: StatisticalForecast with detailed predictions, confidence metrics, and trend analysis

analyze_trend.description: Perform comprehensive time-series trend analysis on a metric. Provides moving averages, trend coefficients, acceleration, seasonality detection, and anomaly scores.

parameters.window_size: int (optional, default=5) - Moving average window size

analyze_trend.returns: TrendAnalysis with historical_values, moving_average, trend_coefficient, acceleration, seasonality_detected, and anomaly_score

calculate_correlations.description: Calculate correlation matrix and identify statistically significant relationships between multiple variables. Useful for understanding which metrics influence each other.

parameters.variables: list - List of variable names to analyze

calculate_correlations.returns: List of CorrelationInsight objects with correlation_strength, statistical_significance, and relationship_type

get_dataset_summary.description: Get a comprehensive statistical summary of all loaded datasets including row counts, column types, and missing data percentages.
get_dataset_summary.returns: Dictionary with dataset information (rows, columns, numeric_columns, categorical_columns, missing_data_pct)
